question: Three polaroid sheets are co-axially placed as indicated in the diagram. Pass axes of the polaroids 2 and 3 make <katex>$30^{\circ}$</katex> and <katex>$90^{\circ}$</katex> with pass axis of polaroid sheet 1. If <katex>$I_{0}$</katex> is the intensity of the incident unpolarised light entering sheet 1, the intensity of the emergent light through sheet 3 is
images/2024-phy-12-1.png
explanation: Intensity after P2 (angle <katex>$30^{\circ}$</katex> with P1): <katex>$I_2 = I_1 \cos^2(30^{\circ}) = (I_0/2) (\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2})^2 = \frac{3I_0}{8}$</katex>.

Intensity after P3 (angle between P2 and P3 is <katex>$90^{\circ} - 30^{\circ} = 60^{\circ}$</katex>): <katex>$I_3 = I_2 \cos^2(60^{\circ}) = (\frac{3I_0}{8}) (\frac{1}{2})^2 = \frac{3I_0}{32}$</katex>.
